column4: hi! I have mysql client issue: # mysql >>> The program 'mysql' can be found in the following packages: * mysql-client-core-5.1; * mysql-cluster-client-5.1; Try: apt-get install <selected package>. But when I try to install it, I have: mysql-client is already the newest version.
I cleaned my sustem of mysql after purge / delete to compile mysql from source
I used rm
So you're attempting to run the one you compiled then?
I compiled the server, not mysql client
Okay, so where do you think you have the client installed from?
client was installed long before
then I rmoved it with apt-get delete / purge
delete, or remove?
both
So you're running 'apt-get install mysql-client-5.1' and getting an error?
exactly as I wrote
You didn't write how you were trying to install it.
I did
um, where?
apt-get install WHAT?
Yeah, the mysql-client package is installed, exactly as it told you.  It's a metapackage.  Install mysql-client-5.1, or do a re-install of mysql-client.
same thing
mysql-client-5.1 is already the newest version. mysql-client-5.1 set to manually installed.
How about mysql-client-core-5.1?
So what happened when you tried installing mysql-client-core-5.1 and doing a reinstall of mysql-client like I said?
